$meta.description: A `netSession` object can be obtained by using [net_use](#METAXPLOIT_NET_USE). The `classID` used for this object is `"NetSession"`.

dump_lib.description: Returns the `metaLib` associated with the remote service. For example if the `metaxpoit` method `net_use` was used on a ssh port it will return the `metaLib` related to the ssh service. In case the port was zero is will return a `metaLib` related to the kernel router.
example: print("Library: " + metaLib.lib_name + " - " + metaLib.version + " on port " + ports[0].port_number)

get_num_users.description: Check how many users the target computer has. Can be useful to check conditions related to using [scan_address](#METAXPLOIT_SCAN_ADDRESS).

get_num_portforward.description: Check how many ports are forwarded on the router of the target computer. Can be useful to check conditions related to using [scan_address](#METAXPLOIT_SCAN_ADDRESS).

get_num_conn_gateway.description: Check how many devices are connected to the router of the target computer. Can be useful to check conditions related to using [scan_address](#METAXPLOIT_SCAN_ADDRESS).

is_any_active_user.description: Check if there is any active user on the target computer. Can be useful to check conditions related to using [scan_address](#METAXPLOIT_SCAN_ADDRESS).

is_root_active_user.description: Check if there is any root user active on the target computer. Can be useful to check conditions related to using [scan_address](#METAXPLOIT_SCAN_ADDRESS).
